Audit and visualize categorical variable cleaning

audit_categorical_cleaning.Rd

This function helps audit the transformation of raw categorical data into cleaned categories. It displays a summary table of the mapping from raw to cleaned values, and optionally creates an alluvial plot to visualize how categories have been collapsed or recoded.

Usage

audit_categorical_cleaning(
  df,
  raw_col,
  cleaned_col,
  var_name = NULL,
  plot = TRUE
)

Arguments

df

A data frame containing the raw and cleaned categorical columns.

raw_col

Unquoted column name for the raw, uncleaned categorical variable.

cleaned_col

Unquoted column name for the cleaned or recoded categorical variable.

var_name

Optional character string to name the variable in printed and plotted output. If NULL, the name of raw_col is used.

plot

Logical, default TRUE. If TRUE, an alluvial plot of the mapping is generated.

Value

A tibble showing the frequency of mappings between raw and cleaned categories. The result is returned invisibly (use invisible()), but printed by default for inspection.
